articles.title: Kim Jong Un Visits Farm under KPA Unit
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Visits Farm under KPA Unit
 Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission, visited Farm No. 1116 under KPA Unit 810.
					 Feasting his eyes on crops doing well in the fields of standardized shapes, cozy public buildings and dwelling houses, he said with great satisfaction that they look nice as they present fantastic scenery of the socialist rural area of the country.
					
					 He looked round a newly arranged room for the education in the revolutionary history.
					
					 Looking with keen interest at data on display there, he said the farm could have turned into an exemplary unit of the country in carrying out the Party's policy for bringing about a radical turn in seed selection thanks to the wise leadership and meticulous care of leader Kim Jong Il who personally initiated the building of the farm and visited it several times, clearly indicating the road for it to follow.
					
					 Now that the room for the education in the revolutionary history has been arranged well, it is necessary for the farm to properly organize the education of its employees so that they might display their intense loyalty and make patriotic devotion in the drive for translating the noble intention of Kim Jong Il into a reality, he added.
					
					 Then he went round its seed research institute, experimental factory and experimental and cultivation fields to learn in detail about research into seed production and management of the farm. 
					
					 He reposed deep trust in the officials of the farm, saying the farm is an experimental farm of the Party Central Committee, which was under the great care of Kim Jong Il and to which he has also paid primary attention.   He underlined the need for the farm to steadily take the lead in implementing the Party's policy for bringing about a radical turn in seed selection in order to effect a signal success in the development of agriculture, a major thrust in the drive for defending socialism.
					
					 Underlining the need to increase state investment in the farm, further consolidate its material and technical foundation and build a modern greenhouse based on cutting-edge technology on it as it is a combined seed research and development base, he promised that the party would make sure that the project for the construction of the greenhouse is undertaken.
					
					 Noting the work for producing new seeds is by no means an easy one, he said it is quite possible to obtain high-yielding seeds if other farms determinedly buckle down to the work and make persevering efforts like this farm.
					
					 Praising the officials, scientists, researchers and employees of the farm as patriots as they are working hard with sweat of their brow and enthusiasm, regardless of whether they are known or not and recognized or not, he said the Party Central Committee would always remember their feats.
					
					 He reposed the deepest trust in KPA General Pak Tong Gyu, who looks after the work at units under KPA Unit 810, praising him as an officer with strong sense of responsibility and desire to work as he carries out anything at any cost by giving play to the mental power of masses if it is desired by the Party.
					
					 Then he had a photo session with the party members and other workers of the farm.
					
					 Accompanying him were Hwang Pyong So, Jo Nam Jin, Ri Jae Il and Jo Yong Won.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Wreath to Bier of Kim Yun
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Wreath to Bier of Kim Yun
 Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un Monday sent a wreath to the bier of Winner of Kim Il Sung Prize, Labor Hero and People's Artiste Kim Yun, artist of the Phibada Opera Troupe, expressing deep condolences over his death.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Chairman of German-Korean Parliamentary Group
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Chairman of German-Korean Parliamentary Group
 Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, met and had a talk with Hartmut Koschyk, chairman of the German-Korean Parliamentary Group, and his party who paid a courtesy call on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Monday.

articles.title: Senior Officials of Party and State Congratulate Children on International Children's Day
articles.content:
Senior Officials of Party and State Congratulate Children on International Children's Day
 Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- Senior party and state officials congratulated children on the International Children's Day. 
					 Kim Yong Nam, Pak Pong Ju, Kwak Pom Ki, Kim Phyong Hae, Ro Tu Chol, Jo Yon Jun, Kim Yong Dae, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, and officials of the party, Cabinet, working people's organizations and power organs visited kindergartens including the kindergarten of Kim Jong Suk Pyongyang Textile Mill and 10-day kindergarten of the Sosamjong Vegetable Farm in Ryokpho District and nurseries and baby homes and orphanages to congratulate the children on the day.
					
					 They laid bouquets before the pictures of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il smiling among children and paid tributes to them.
					
					 They went round rooms dedicated to the histories of the relevant units, education rooms, nursing rooms, playgrounds and exercise rooms and appreciated the colorful sports and amusement games and art performances given by the children.
					
					 They requested the educators and nurses to do nursing and education for the children better and thus bring up them to be the successors to the revolution and reliable pillars of prosperous Korea.

articles.title: Friendship Gathering Marks Anniversary of Kim Jong Un's Visit to Pyongyang Orphanage
articles.content:
Friendship Gathering Marks Anniversary of Kim Jong Un's Visit to Pyongyang Orphanage
 Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- A friendship gathering took place at Pyongyang Orphanage Monday to mark the first anniversary of supreme leader Kim Jong Un's visit to the orphanage to congratulate orphans on the International Children's Day and the 65th anniversary of the day.
					 Present there were Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, officials concerned, orphans, nurses and employees of Pyongyang Baby Home and Orphanage, orphans who are studying at Pyongyang Mirim School after graduating from the orphanage and exemplary nurses, teachers, members of the women's union and children in Pyongyang.
					
					 Present there on invitation were staff members of diplomatic missions and international bodies here, foreign guests, overseas Koreans and the chief of the Pyongyang mission of the Anti-Imperialist National Democratic Front.
					
					 Kim Jong Sun, chairwoman of the Central Committee of the Democratic Women's Union of Korea, warmly congratulated the Korean and foreign children on the International Children's Day.
					
					 She expressed belief that children would grow up to be loyalists trusting and following Kim Jong Un only and pillars of prosperous Korea who are knowledgeable, moral and healthy.
					
					 Brass band of Kumsong Secondary School No. 1 and artistes of the Pyongyang Puppet Company gave performances to congratulate children on the International Children's Day.
					
					 A joint performance was given by orphans and teachers of Pyongyang Orphanage and children of different countries.
					
					 Then followed sports and amusement games.
					
					 At the end of the games, participants spent a pleasant time, dancing with the orphans. 
					
					 Colorful events took place in all provinces, cities (districts) and counties on the day.

articles.title: Delegation of Central Bank Leaves for Russia
articles.content:
Delegation of Central Bank Leaves for Russia
 Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Central Bank led by President Kim Chon Gyun left here on Monday to take part in the 24th International Bank Congress due in Sankt-Peterburg, Russia.

articles.title: GFTUK Delegation Leaves for Switzerland
articles.content:
GFTUK Delegation Leaves for Switzerland
 Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea (GFTUK) led by Kim Tong Son, vice-chairman of its Central Committee, left here Monday to take part in the meeting of the Presidential Council of the World Federation of Trade Unions to be held in Geneva.

articles.title: Military Band of KPA Back Home
articles.content:
Military Band of KPA Back Home
 Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- The Military Band of the Korean People's Army (KPA) led by Senior Colonel Nam Chol came back home on Monday after taking part in the 4th International Military Music Festival "Waves of River Amur" among countries in the Asia-Pacific region held in Khabarovsk, Russia.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Un from Russian Figure
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Un from Russian Figure
 Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un received a gift from Valery Khalilov, head and chief conductor of the Military-Orchestra Service of the Armed Forces of the Russian Federation.
					 Valery Khalilov handed the gift over to an official concerned of the Military Band of the Korean People's Army who took part in the 4th International Military Music Festival among countries in the Asia-Pacific region on May 31.

articles.title: Secretary General of Commission for Foreign Affairs of Senate of Italy Visits Mangyongdae
articles.content:
Secretary General of Commission for Foreign Affairs of Senate of Italy Visits Mangyongdae
 Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- Antonio Razzi, secretary general of the Commission for Foreign Affairs of the Senate of Italy, and his party visited Mangyongdae, the birthplace of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The guests went round historical relics preserved with good care at the old home, being briefed on the immortal revolutionary history of the President and the patriotic life of his family members.
					
					 They also visited the e-library and swimming pool of Kim Il Sung University, the International Friendship Exhibition House and the Munsu Rehabilitation Clinic.

articles.title: Chairman of German-Korean Parliamentary Group Leaves
articles.content:
Chairman of German-Korean Parliamentary Group Leaves
 Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- Hartmut Koschyk, chairman of the German-Korean Parliamentary Group, and his party left here for home Monday.

articles.title: World No Tobacco Day Marked
articles.content:
World No Tobacco Day Marked
 Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- An event took place at the People's Palace of Culture on Monday on World No Tobacco Day.
					 Present there were officials in the field of public health, ministries, national institutions and public organizations and the acting representative of the WHO, members of missions of international organizations, foreign diplomatic envoys and foreign embassy officials here.
					
					 Speakers said that WHO set it as a theme for this year to prevent the smuggling of tobacco goods in order to intensify the no-smoking campaign.
					
					 They called for strengthening the propaganda activities against negative aftermath of smuggling of tobacco goods on a socio-economic life and people's health and increasing the degree of control and supervision in order to thoroughly prevent the smuggling and decisively bringing down the number of people smoking.
					
					 There was a briefing on the WHO's convention on tobacco control framework and protocol on banning illegal tobacco dealing.
					
					 They watched a video on the control over sale of tobacco and enjoyed a performance given by a hygienic information disseminating team of pupils.

articles.title: DPRK Pays Big Efforts to Protection of Intangible Heritages
articles.content:
DPRK Pays Big Efforts to Protection of Intangible Heritages
 Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- 25 items of assets have been registered as national intangible heritages in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea up till now.
					 In this regard, an official of the National Authority for the Protection of Cultural Heritage, said:
					
					 The DPRK government has established disciplined system for protection of intangible heritages, paying deep attention to discovering them.
					
					 Among those registered as national intangible heritages are folk song "Arirang", "Method of Making Kimchi", "Ssirum" (Korean wrestling) etc.
					
					"Arirang" was already listed as one of world intangible heritages.

articles.title: Magnolia, National Flower of DPRK
articles.content:
Magnolia, National Flower of DPRK
 Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- Magnolia, the national flower of the DPRK, is coming into full bloom nowadays. 
					 Magnolia was called Mokryonhwa in Korean long ago.
					
					 President Kim Il Sung suggested calling Mokryonhwa Mokran, saying the Korean people have traditionally added the Korean word "ran" to the name of fragrant and beautiful flowers.
					
					 He also called for listing magnolia as the national flower of the DPRK.
					
					 Leader Kim Jong Il made sure that magnolia, which the President loved so much, was propagated in all parts of the country.

articles.title: Oriental Birds from South Nest in DPRK
articles.content:
Oriental Birds from South Nest in DPRK
 Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- It has been recently confirmed that birds of tropical genealogy from the Oriental region inhabit in flock the arboretum of the Central Botanical Garden in the DPRK.
					 According to Kim Kyong Jun, section chief of the Zoology Research Institute under the State Academy of Sciences, those birds lived in the area around the lower River Hapjang in the past, but now they are nesting in the wide forest zone along the middle and upper river, numbering at least 1 000.
					
					 They include Egreta garzetta, Egreta intermedia, Egreta alba, Nyticorax nyticorax and Bubulcus ibis.
					
					 The fact shows that the arboretum area has turned into a zone with ecological environment favorable for the inhabitation of animals.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Dismisses S. Korean Puppet Regime's False Propaganda
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Dismisses S. Korean Puppet Regime's False Propaganda 
 Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- The inter-Korean relations are being pushed to the worst catastrophe as the days go by due to a tinny handful of traitors.
					 On May 28 the south Korean conservative media News 1 aired a false report that there was a collision between a patrol craft and fishing boat of the DPRK and a submarine of Russia in the East Sea of Korea last year and the north "forced" the survivors to settle in other area to keep it secret.
					
					 Chosun Ilbo, Dong-A Ilbo and other conservative media are joining in the smear campaign while talking about "cultivation of drug" and "luxury of privileged circle."
					
					 The south Korean conservative media are all out to let loose a litany of malignant invectives against the north, while spreading fictions about last year's "collision" and "forcible settlement in other area." Why?
					
					 The Park Geun Hye regime is chiefly to blame for this unprecedented anti-DPRK smear campaign.
					
					 It considers the confrontation between the north and the south as indispensable means for its existence as it is breathing its last due to its domestic and foreign policy failure.
					
					 Her regime is getting disintegrated beyond control and hit hard from all sides for its political crisis and subsequent social catastrophe and confusion. 
					
					 It is vexed with the daily increasing politico-military might of the DPRK, the might of single-minded unity and the DPRK-Russia relations growing stronger as the days go by.
					
					 The group of traitors is busy conducting the above-said false propaganda in a bid to divert elsewhere the south Korean people and the world public's bitter criticism of it.
					
					 Park Geun Hye is finding herself in such poor position as to spearhead the smear campaign against the DPRK, terming its just measure for self-defence "threat" and "provocation", decrying its line of simultaneously pushing ahead with the two fronts and grumbling about "human rights abuse" and "instability."
					
					 In the grip of extreme fear and uneasiness, the regime is working hard to whip media and riff-raffs toward total confrontation with the DPRK, a foolish act of jumping into fire with faggot on one's back.
					
					 The DPRK had already made a solemn declaration that those who hurt the dignity of its supreme leadership and drive the inter-Korean relations into the worst catastrophe would be the primary target of its punishment.
					
					 They include the Park Geun Hye group keen on the anti-DPRK smear campaign and other producers of scenarios against it and wicked conservative media involved in it for a petty amount of money.
					
					 If they truly want to survive, they had better behave themselves, clearly understanding the will of the service personnel and people of the DPRK to make retaliatory punishment.

articles.title: S. Korean Puppet Forces' Scheme to Set up UN "Office on Human Rights in North" in Seoul under Fire
articles.content:
S. Korean Puppet Forces' Scheme to Set up UN "Office on Human Rights in North" in Seoul under Fire
 Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- Shortly ago, the south Korean puppet forces signed an agreement to set up the UN "office on human rights in the north" in Seoul. They announced that they would officially open the office in Seoul within June.
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday in a commentary terms their action an unpardonable hideous politically-motivated provocation and an open declaration of a war as it is a heinous and sinister intention to persistently do harm to the dignity of the DPRK and its social system and realize their ambition to isolate and stifle it at any cost.
					
					 Despite sanctions and pressure the DPRK has made dynamic progress forward. Much upset by this, the U.S. is hatching a crafty plot while pinning hope on its "human rights" racket, the commentary says, and goes on:
					
					 Those who have rolled up their sleeves to act as a shock brigade for executing the U.S. "human rights" racket against the DPRK is none other than the puppet traitors in south Korea.
					
					 The puppet hooligans who stoop to any infamy to hurt the DPRK are deliberately turning their faces away from the reality in the DPRK in which the sovereign rights of the people are being displayed at the highest stage nor would they want to believe in it.
					
					 Running sky-high now is the will of the army and people of the DPRK to revenge on the puppet group of traitors who unhesitatingly commit hideous politically-motivated provocation against the supreme dignity and the inviolable social system in the DPRK while getting hell-bent on escalating confrontation with the fellow countrymen.
					
					 It is self-evident that the UN office which the U.S. and the south Korean forces try to set up in Seoul in order to tarnish the image of the dignified DPRK, stifle it and realize their dirty scheme of "unification of social systems" can never evade harsh punishment by the army and people of the DPRK.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Denounces S. Korean Puppet Group for Disturbing Activities of International Women's Grand March
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Denounces S. Korean Puppet Group for Disturbing Activities of International Women's Grand March
 Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Monday in a commentary denounces the south Korean puppet group for desperately disturbing the activities of the 2015 international women's grand march for reunification and peace in Korea.
					 Displeased with the call made by the members of the delegation for the independent and peaceful reunification of Korea and their visits to Mangyongdae and other places during their stay in Pyongyang, the puppet forces groundlessly termed the above-said action "pro-north event". 
					
					 Moreover, they complained that remarks made by members of the delegation denouncing the thrice-cursed crimes committed by the U.S. imperialists against humanity during the Korean War "assumed anti-U.S. and pro-north tendency." 
					
					 Even they barred the delegation from passing through Panmunjom under the pretext of "disallowance of the UN Command" and allowed instead its travel along the road on the West coast. They hurled ultra-right conservative gangsters into an area near the Military Demarcation Line to stage "counter demonstration," branding it as "an organization praising the north" and "anti-U.S. and pro-north body."
					
					 This was an unpardonable insult to the conscience of mankind aspiring after independence, peace and justice and a criminal action of dampening the unanimous desire of the Koreans for the country's reunification. 
					
					 It is owing to these wicked confrontation and war maniacs now in power in south Korea that the inter-Korean relations remain at the lowest ebb and the confrontation and tension are escalating day by day on the Korean peninsula.
					
					 Only stern judgment of the era and nation await the traitors hell-bent on the anti-DPRK confrontation racket in collusion with outside forces.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Raps Japan's Grave Moves to Emerge Military Giant
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Raps Japan's Grave Moves to Emerge Military Giant
 Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- War criminal state Japan has entered a grave phase in its moves to become a military giant.
					 Commenting on this, Rodong Sinmun Monday says: This means Japan has gone far beyond the control line called "three principles of arms export"-- ban on arms export, technology transfer to other countries and joint development and production of weapons.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries have invariably pursued their ambition for overseas expansion, the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					 They have systematically stepped up preparations for overseas expansion in a bid to realize the old dream of "Greater East Asia Co-Prosperity Sphere", crying out for "revenge" for their past defeat.
					
					 They have already worked out a "national security strategy" and set up the "national security council." They formally adopted overseas invasion as a state policy and are in the process of implementing it.
					
					 The retrogressive revision of the "Japan-U.S. defence cooperation guidelines" made it possible for the "Self-Defence Forces" to conduct their activities without limit. 
					
					 Now that the SDF have turned into forces for aggression, what remains to be done by Japan at present is to modernize them so that their mobile strike and operation capabilities on the ground, in the sea and the air may be bolstered up to the maximum and have in place weaponry huge enough to fight an actual war. 
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries are mulling attaining this goal by coordinating the operations of Mitsubishi Heavy Industry, Kawasaki Heavy Industry and other munitions industries.
					
					 These robust munitions industries are strongly backing the authorities' reckless moves to turn Japan into a military giant and launch overseas invasion.
					
					 The on-going moves of the Japanese government and munitions industries are reminiscent of the situation on the eve of the Pacific War.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries are dreaming of reinvasion of Asia to dominate it.

articles.title: Respiratory Syndrome MERS Spreads in S. Korea
articles.content:
Respiratory Syndrome MERS Spreads in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- respiratory syndrome MERS, a high-mortality respiratory epidemic, continues spreading in south Korea, according to the south Korean MBC and CBS. 
					 The south Korean health authorities clarified that 13 were found to have been infected by MERS as of May 30. 
					
					 All of them were reportedly infected from the first patient who was under treatment at the same hospital they were staying. 
					
					 A man, who was freed from the quarantine after his treatment at the hospital, developed the symptom in a foreign country. 
					
					 There is a great concern about the spread of MERS as there were 160 odd people on the plane which he took and he contacted other people in his workshop.

articles.title: S. Korean Paper Slams U.S. Attempt of Biochemical War
articles.content:
S. Korean Paper Slams U.S. Attempt of Biochemical War
 Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- The south Korean internet paper Minjok Ilbo on May 29 carried an editorial as regards the revelation of the hideous criminal acts of the U.S. imperialists who have made preparations for a dangerous biochemical war.
					 The editorial referred to the fact that an institute of the U.S. Defense Department sent active anthrax germs into the Osan U.S. air force base in south Korea. 
					
					 The spread of the germs in Seoul can cause 900 000 casualties to the maximum, the editorial deplored.
					
					 It stressed that it is by no means accidental that the 23rd Chemical Battalion with the capacity of coping with a biochemical war was deployed in the U.S. Second Division in south Korea in 2013 and south Korea staged an exercise for defending against biological weapons with the U.S. in August last year. 
					
					 Nevertheless, the Park Geun Hye regime has not protested against the U.S., the editorial said, stressing south Korea is neither a battlefield for the U.S. army nor a laboratory of biochemical weapons. 
					
					 The traitorous Park Geun Hye regime, which is following and helping the U.S., has to immediately step down, it demanded.

articles.title: Worst Joblessness among S. Korean Young People
articles.content:
Worst Joblessness among S. Korean Young People
 Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- Young people in south Korea are now suffering from worst joblessness.
					 According to the data released by the puppet Agency of Statistics on May 19, the number of jobless young people steadily increased in March and April in the wake of February. The number reached more than 95 000 by the end of April, an all-time high in the past 12 years.
					
					 The south Korean internet newspaper Voice of People on May 20 deplored that the "government" has no proposal to settle this issue.
					
					 South Korean paper Hangyore also deplored that young people in south Korea are leading a miserable life.
					
					 The young people in south Korea are unanimous in saying that there is nothing to expect from Park Geun Hye.

articles.title: Strike in Protest against Discrimination of Part-time Workers Staged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Strike in Protest against Discrimination of Part-time Workers Staged in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- Part-time workers of schools of south Korea staged a strike in protest against unreasonable discriminative measure.
					 A press conference related to the sit-in strike was held in Seoul on May 28.
					
					 They urged the regime to take a step for job security and removal of discrimination against part-time workers of schools and immediately opt to institute a law on educational officials.
					
					 They said that they would massively stage actions including sit-in strikes and meetings in order to prevent wage discrimination and massive discharge of part-time workers of schools in different parts of south Korea.

articles.title: Meeting to Open Jaju Sibo Held in S. Korea
articles.content:
Meeting to Open Jaju Sibo Held in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- Members of the Association for Supporting Prisoners of Conscience of the Family Movement for Realizing Democracy, the Solidarity for Progress and other south Korean civic and public organizations and media persons held a meeting to open Jaju Sibo in Seoul on May 28.
					 Speakers said that various circles of south Korea formed the all-people committee for measures for checking the shutdown of Jaju Minbo and conducted a struggle for defending progressive media against the moves of the authorities to shut down Jaju Minbo.
					
					 Although Jaju Minbo was forcibly shut down, activities continued to turn the all-people committee for measures into the preparatory committee for publishing Jaju Sibo and make it popular media for the people, they noted.
					
					 They said that the way for the media to follow is to write articles that can help the thorough implementation of the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration.
					
					 They stressed that as Jaju Minbo had taken the lead, Jaju Sibo would also do its best till the day of reunification.

articles.title: Moves to Deploy THAAD in S. Korea Slammed
articles.content:
Moves to Deploy THAAD in S. Korea Slammed
 Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Internet paper Minjok Ilbo carried an editorial "Deployment of THAAD is an international burlesque to bring benefits to military and industrial complexes" on May 29. 
					 Despite rebuffs at home and abroad and controversies over expense and efficiency, the U.S. and the Park Geun Hye regime are making desperate efforts to deploy THAAD in south Korea, sparking off concerns at home and abroad, the editorial said, adding: 
					
					 The deployment of THAAD in south Korea is a demand of the U.S. to defend its mainland and an international burlesque for meeting the interests of the U.S. military and industrial complexes.

articles.title: Pomminryon South Headquarters Call for Successful Joint National Events
articles.content:
Pomminryon South Headquarters Call for Successful Joint National Events
 Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- The South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification released a statement under the title of "Nobody can match concerted efforts of the nation" on May 20.
					 The statement referred to the fact that Koreans in the south, the north and abroad were preparing joint national events in order to mark the 15th anniversary of the historic June 15 joint declaration and the 70th anniversary of Korea's liberation as grand festivals for national reunification to be noteworthy in the national history.
					
					 It is a pressing task for all Koreans to achieve the great national unity and open an epochal phase for peace and reunification in this significant year, the statement noted, and went on:
					
					 Having the joint national events would offer a good occasion for making enthusiasm for the national reunification that ran high in the June 15 era for reunification rage again, and achieving reconciliation and unity.
					
					 The Park Geun Hye regime encouraged the anti-DPRK leaflet scattering operations and checked the inter-Korean dialogue by setting in motion the "preparatory committee for unification" for escalating confrontation with social systems. 
					
					 Successful joint national events will serve as a touchstone showing the Park Geun Hye regime's attitude to the June 15 joint declaration and the independent civic movement for national reunification.
					
					 The statement called upon the Korean people in the south, the north and abroad to pool their efforts for the successful realization of the joint national events.

articles.title: Discrimination against Korean Schools and Distortion of History by Japan Accused
articles.content:
Discrimination against Korean Schools and Distortion of History by Japan Accused
 Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) ? The Citizens Council for Defending Schools and Children in south Korea launched a Friday action in Seoul on May 29 in demand of the abolition of the Japanese government's policy of discrimination against the Korean schools in Japan and a halt to its distortion of history.
					 Speakers said the Japanese government still keeps the Korean schools in Japan off the list for the application for the tuition-free program for senior high schools, and that local self-governing bodies have suspended the provision of subsidies.
					
					 They accused the government of getting hell-bent on the distortion of history and moves for seizing the land, while denying the historical fact that Tok Islets are the part of the inviolable territory of Korea and holding an event called "Takeshima (Tok Islets) Day".
					
					 They denounced Japan's discrimination against the Korean schools in Japan as an act of violating the international convention on ensuring the right of children by which all children are granted the right to education without any discrimination.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Letter of Thanks Introduced in Nigeria
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Letter of Thanks Introduced in Nigeria
 Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- The Nigerian National Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism posted on its website the full text of supreme leader Kim Jong Un's letter of thanks "To the Party and Youth League Organizations That Have Trained Young People into the Vanguard of the Era" on May 26.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Exploits Praised by Myanmar Personages
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Exploits Praised by Myanmar Personages 
 Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- Myanmar personages made public statements on May 19 and 25 to mark the 51st anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK). 
					 Tha Win, member of the Central Committee of the Union Solidarity and Development Party of Myanmar who doubles as secretary of the Yangon Regional Committee, in a statement said Kim Jong Il developed the WPK into the invincible iron-willed party performing immortal exploits before the times and history with his outstanding idea and wise guidance for nearly five decades. 
					
					 Tin Tun, director of the Myanmar Medical Research Institute, said under the leadership of Kim Jong Il the WPK has developed into the invincible iron-willed party and the Korean revolution has invariably advanced along the way of victory. 
					
					 He expressed the belief that the WPK and the Korean people under the wise leadership of HE Kim Jong Un will achieve greater successes in the drive for building a thriving nation and achieving national reunification.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un recorre granja no. 1116 de EPC
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un recorre granja no. 1116 de EPC
Pyongyang, 1 de junio (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, dirigio en el terreno la granja no. 1116 adscrita a la unidad 810 del EPC.
					Contemplando los cultivos que crecen en las parcelas extendidas ordenadamente y los graciosos edificios publicos y las viviendas, el dijo que el panorama es fantastico y deviene ademas otra escena orgullosa del campo socialista del pais.
					
					Primero, el Mariscal estuvo en la sala de educacion en la historia revolucionaria construida de nuevo.
					
					Examinando atentamente los datos exhibidos, el senalo que gracias a la sabia orientacion y la minuciosa atencion del Dirigente Kim Jong Il quien tomo la iniciativa de construir dicha granja e ilumino el camino a seguir visitandola en varias ocasiones, la granja pudo convertirse en el modelo de todo el pais en materializar la orientacion del partido de hacer la revolucion de semillas.
					
					La granja debe organizar con escrupulosidad la educacion de los empleados dado que se ha acondicionado bien la sala para que ellos manifiesten su elevada fidelidad y abnegacion patriotica en llevar a feliz termino el noble proposito del Dirigente, acoto.
					
					Pasando revista al instituto de semillas, la fabrica de experimento y las parcelas de examen y cultivo, el estudio detalladamente la labor de investigacion de nuevas variedades y el estado de administracion de la granja.
					
					Infundiendo a los funcionarios de la granja la gran confianza de que la granja es el campo de examen del Comite Central del PTC a que el Dirigente presto gran atencion y el mismo le deposita gran interes, el puntualizo que la granja debe estar siempre en la delantera de la materializacion de la orientacion del partido de hacer la revolucion de semilla para que se diera jaque mate en el frente agricola, linea de ofensiva principal en la lucha por la defensa del socialismo.
					
					Es necesario intensificar la inversion estatal y preparar mas firmemente la base material-tecnico porque la granja no. 1116 es la base integral de investigacion y desarrollo de semillas,  dijo y ordeno construir el moderno invernadero en que se aplicaran las tecnicas de punta y dio la benevolencia de que el partido se encargara de esa obra.
					
					No es facil el trabajo de obtener nuevas semillas, destaco y prosiguio que es posible conseguir las semillas de buena variedad cuando todos se esfuercen con empeno como lo hizo la granja no. 1116.
					
					Asevero con tono afectuoso que son patriotas los funcionarios, cientificos, investigadores y empleados de la granja quienes dedican su sudor y pasion  y que el CC del PTC no olvidara jamas sus proezas.
					
					Dio la maxima confianza al general del EPC Pak Tong Gyu, quien se encarga de los trabajos de las entidades adscritas a la unidad 810, apreciandole como funcionario fuerte en la responsabilidad y el entusiasmo por el trabajo, con los cuales cumple a toda costa movilizando la espiritualidad de las masas todos los que desea el partido. 
					
					El Mariscal se fotografio junto con los militantes del partido y los trabajadores de la granja.
					
					Le acompanaron en la ocasion Hwang Pyong So, Jo Nam Jin, Ri Jae Il y Jo Yong Won.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un envia ofrenda floral ante feretro de difunto Kim Yun
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un envia ofrenda floral ante feretro de difunto Kim Yun
Pyongyang, 1 de junio (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un envio el dia primero una ofrenda floral ante el feretro del difunto Kim Yun, laureado con el Premio Kim Il Sung, Heroe del Trabajo, Artista del Pueblo y pintor del Conjunto Operistico Mar de Sangre, en senal de profundas condolencias por su fallecimiento.

Kim Yong Nam se reune con Hartmut Koschyk y su comitiva
Pyongyang, 1 de junio (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, departio el dia primero en el Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae con el presidente del grupo parlamentario de amistad Alemania-Corea, Hartmut Koschyk y su comitiva.

articles.title: Cuadros de RPDC felicitan a los ninos
articles.content:
Cuadros de RPDC felicitan a los ninos
Pyongyang, 1 de junio (ACNC) -- Kim Yong Nam, Pak Pong Ju, Kwak Pom Gi, Kim Pyong Hae, Ro Tu Chol, Jo Yon Jun, el vicepresidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema, Kim Yong Dae y los cuadros del Partido, el Consejo de Ministros, organizaciones de trabajadores y organos de poder visitaron el Jardin de la Infancia de la Fabrica Textil Kim Jong Suk de Pyongyang, el Jardin de la Infancia Dia 10 de la Granja Cooperativa Especializada en Verduras de Sosamjong del municipio Ryokpho, el Jardin de la Infancia de Ryonhwa del municipio Jung, el Jardin de la Infancia de Kwanmun No.1 del municipio Raknang y otros jardines de la infancia, guarderias infantiles, hospicios y orfanatos y felicitaron a los ninos que celebran la fiesta.
					Ellos rindieron homenaje al Presidente Kim Il Sung y el Dirigente Kim Jong Il tras depositar los ramos de flores ante la obra con sus imagenes sonrientes entre los ninos.
					
					Y recorrieron la sala de presentacion del historial, las salas de educacion, crianza, juego universal y gimnasia y otros y presenciaron el juego de recreos deportivos y la funcion artistica de los ninos.
					
					Los cuadros del Partido y el Estado encargaron a todas las educadoras a criar y educar mejor a los ninos y formarlos como herederos de la revolucion coreana y firmes futuros pilares de Corea prospera.

articles.title: Efectuado encuentro de amistad en Orfanato de Pyongyang
articles.content:
Efectuado encuentro de amistad en Orfanato de Pyongyang
Pyongyang, 1 de junio (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia primero en el Orfanato de Pyongyang un encuentro de amistad por el 1o aniversario de la visita del Mariscal Kim Jong Un y el 65o aniversario del Dia Internacional de la Infancia.
					Estuvieron presentes el vicepresidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema, Yang Hyong Sop, los funcionarios interesados, los huerfanos, educadoras y empleados del hospicio y orfanato de Pyongyang, los ninos que estudian en la Escuela Mirim de Pyongyang tras graduarse del orfanato y las ejemplares educadoras, miembros de la Union de Mujeres Democraticas de Corea (UMDC) y ninos de esta capital.
					
					Tambien fueron invitados los miembros de las representaciones diplomaticos y de organizaciones internacionales, los huespedes extranjeros, los coreanos residentes en ultramar y el representante de la sucursal del Frente Democratico Nacional Antiimperialista en Pyongyang.
					
					La presidenta del Comite Central de UMDC, Kim Jong Sun felicito a todos los ninos de todo el pais que celebran el Dia Internacional de la Infancia bajo el amor del Mariscal Kim Jong Un y a los ninos de varios paises participantes en la ocasion.
					
					Ella expreso la conviccion de que los ninos se formaran firmemente como futuros pilares de la Corea prospera, fieles infinitamente al Mariscal y listos con ricos conocimientos, nobles virtudes y buena salud.
					
					Para felicitar a los ninos que celebran el Dia Internacional de la Infancia, se ofrecieron la musica de instrumentos de viento de los alumnos de la Escuela Secundaria No.1 Kumsong y la funcion de titeres de los artistas del Conjunto de Titeres de Pyongyang.
					
					Y fue efectuada la funcion conjunta de los huerfanos y educadoras del Orfanato de Pyongyang y los ninos de varios paises.
					
					Luego hubo el juego de recreos deportivos.
					
					Al terminar el juego, los participantes pasaron el tiempo alegre bailando con los huerfanos del Orfanato de Pyongyang. 
					
					Por otra parte, fueron efectuados en todas las provincias, ciudades (municipios) y distritos variados actos dedicados al Dia Internacional de la Infancia.

articles.title: Efectuado en RPDC acto dedicado al Dia Mundial de No Fumar
articles.content:
Efectuado en RPDC acto dedicado al Dia Mundial de No Fumar
Pyongyang, 1 de junio (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia primero en el Palacio Cultural del Pueblo el acto dedicado al Dia Mundial de No Fumar.
					En la ocasion estuvieron presentes los funcionarios de sector de la salud publica, ministerios, organos centrales, entidades sociales y rama correspondiente, miembros de representaciones de varias organizaciones internacionales, incluido la representante interina de la Organizacion Mundial de la Salud (OMS), los representantes diplomaticos e integrantes de embajadas, de varios paises, acreditados en Corea.
					
					En el acto hubo discursos.
					
					Los oradores mencionaron que la OMS determino como tema de este ano la prevencion de la venta ilicita de los cigarrillos con el proposito de fortalecer mas las actividades para no fumar.
					
					Ellos exhortaron a impedirla y disminuir el porcentaje de la accion de fumar al elevar el nivel de las actividades de propaganda sobre las consecuencias negativas de la venta ilicita de los cigarrillos que influyen a la vida socio-economica y a la salud de la gente y activar la inspeccion y el control.
					
					Continuamente hubo la explicacion sobre el acuerdo de control de cigarrillos y el protocolo sobre la erradicacion de los negocios ilicitos.
					
					Por ultimo, los participantes presenciaron el video referente al control de la venta ilicita de cigarrillos y funcion del grupo de propaganda higienica de los alumnos.
